problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCD shape is a rectangle where a semi-circle has been removed from one side of it, the ABFG shape is a combination of a rectangle and a semi-circle, the perimeter of the ABFG shape is 64 and the perimeter of the BCI triangle is 27, compute the perimeter of the ABCD shape. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 20465.649999999998)
C = (6034.23, 20465.649999999998)
D = (6034.23, 34.23)
F = (-8965.77, 20465.649999999998)
G = (-8965.77, 34.23)
I = (1284.23, 30387.21)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 20))

# Draw the purple rectangle (A, B, C, D)
purple_rect = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D], closed=True, color="purple", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(purple_rect)

# Draw the blue rectangle with semicircle (A, B, F, G)
blue_rect = patches.Polygon([A, B, F, G], closed=True, color="blue", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(blue_rect)

# Draw the semicircle on the blue rectangle
semicircle = patches.Arc((A[0] - 4.5, A[1]), 9, 9, theta1=0, theta2=180, color="blue", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(semicircle)

# Draw the cyan triangle (B, C, I)
cyan_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, C, I], closed=True, color="cyan", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_triangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, C, D)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, B, A)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, F, B)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(I[0], I[1], "I", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, B[1] + 1, "9", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")
ax.text((B[0] + I[0]) / 2, (B[1] + I[1]) / 2, "10", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")
ax.text((C[0] + I[0]) / 2, (C[1] + I[1]) / 2, "11", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-14965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 35034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The perimeter of the ABFG shape is 64 and the length of the BF side is 9, so $2 * OtherSide + 9 + \frac{9 * 3.14}{2} = 64$. So $2 * OtherSide = 64 - 9 - \frac{9 * 3.14}{2} = 64 - 9 - \frac{28.26}{2} = 64 - 9 - 14.13 = 40.87$. Therefore, the length of the AB side is $\frac{40.87}{2} = 20.43$. The lengths of the BI and CI sides of the BCI triangle are 10 and 11 and the perimeter is 27, so the lengths of the BC side equals $27 - 10 - 11 = 6$. The diameter of the semi-circle in the ABCD shape is equal to the side of the rectangle with length 6 so the shape has two sides with length 20.43, one with length 6, and one semi-circle arc with diameter 6. So the perimeter of the ABCD shape is $2 * 20.43 + 6 + \frac{6 * 3.14}{2} = 40.86 + 6 + \frac{18.84}{2} = 40.86 + 6 + 9.42 = 56.28$. Therefore the final answer is 56.28.
